Package it.unimore.iot.health.api.datamanager.persistence

Class InventoryDataManager

java.lang.Object
it.unimore.iot.health.api.datamanager.persistence.InventoryDataManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IInventoryDataManager
public class InventoryDataManager extends Object implements IInventoryDataManager
InventoryDataManager is a class implementation of IInventoryDataManager interface. This class provides all the necessary methods to handle PatientDescriptor objects and HealthCheckDescriptor objects saved in the RAM. Therefore, this class implements the required persistence to correctly support CRUD interactions at API RESTful level
Author:
Christopher Zanoli, Undergraduate student - 270765@studenti.unimore.it

    • updatePatient

      public void updatePatient(PatientDescriptor patientDescriptorSource) throws IllegalAccessException, NoSuchFieldException
      This method allows to update a specific patient's data passing a new PatientDescriptor during the PUT interaction.
      Specified by:
      updatePatient in interface IInventoryDataManager
      Parameters:
      patientDescriptorSource - is the PatientDescriptor object coming from the PUT, whose non-null fields must override the PatientDescriptorDestination's fields already present in the patientMap.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException - exception thrown with respect to copyDifferences() method.
      NoSuchFieldException - exception thrown with respect to copyDifferences() method
      Since:
      1.0

      Since:
      1.0

    • getHealthCheckByFilter

      public List<HealthCheckDescriptor> getHealthCheckByFilter(String patientId, String anomaly) throws DataManagerException
      This method allows to retrieve the healthcheck list according to some filtering criteria:
      1. If anomaly is provided as query parameter then they must necessarily also provide patientId as query parameter and the final list will contain all the healthchecks of a particular patient that are anomalous in one of the following aspects: [heart rate, saturation, glucose, temperature]
      2. If anomaly is not provided (null), then a list of healthchecks of a particular patient is returned, regardless of the possible anomalies
      Specified by:
      getHealthCheckByFilter in interface IInventoryDataManager
      Parameters:
      patientId - a String representing the patient identifier.
      anomaly - a pre-configured String representing the macro-type of anomaly a client needs to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a List of filtered healthchecks.
      Throws:
      DataManagerException - if the anomaly String provided by the client does not match the pre-configured query strings
      Since:
      1.0

    • createNewHealthCheck

      public HealthCheckDescriptor createNewHealthCheck(HealthCheckDescriptor healthCheckDescriptor) throws DataManagerException
      This method creates a new healthcheck in the healthCheckMap, given a HealthCheckDescriptor as input.
      Specified by:
      createNewHealthCheck in interface IInventoryDataManager
      Parameters:
      healthCheckDescriptor - it is the HealthCheckDescriptor to be created.
      Returns:
      the HealthCheckDescriptor created.
      Throws:
      DataManagerException - if the healthCheckDescriptor provided cannot be created.
